children.name: the feeling you have when you are hungry
hunger b1
children.definition: hunger the feeling you have when you have eaten very little food: cơn đói
examples: the baby screamed with hunger.
many slimming diets don’t provide enough calories to satisfy hunger.
hunger pangsthe uncomfortable feelings in your stomach that tell you are very hungry: đau bụng đói
if you do feel hunger pangs, nibble on carrot, celery, or cucumber sticks.

children.name: appetite c1
children.definition: appetite the feeling of wanting to eat when you have not eaten for some time - use this especially when sb does not have their normal desire to eat, for example when they are ill: sự thèm ăn
examples: how’s his appetite? is he getting enough to eat?
her husband always had a huge appetite.
symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
a good/healthy appetitegrowing children should have a healthy appetite.
a big/huge/enormous appetiteby the time ron was 16 he had an enormous appetite.
a poor appetitea poor appetite may be a sign of illness.
a small appetitemy aunt only had a small appetite.
have an appetitethere’s lots of food – i hope you have a good appetite.
lose your appetiteshe was so miserable that she completely lost her appetite.
give sb an appetite(alsostimulate your appetiteformal)the exercise and fresh air had given us an appetite.|the aroma of the herbs and spices helps stimulate the appetite.
spoil/ruin your appetite(= make you not feel like eating a meal )don’t give the children any more sweets – it will spoil their appetite.
loss/lack of appetitesymptoms include fever and loss of appetite.|i’m a bit worried about her lack of appetite.

children.name: need a drink a1
children.definition: need a drink especially spoken to want to drink sth, especially because you are very thirsty or because you want an alcoholic drink:cần uống gì đó
examples: jeez it’s hot. i need a drink.
i need another drink if we’re going to keep talking about this.

children.name: dry a2
children.definition: dry when yourthroatormouthis dry, it has very little liquid in it, so that you feel that you want a drink:khô
examples: my throat was so dry i could hardly speak.

children.name: dehydrated x
children.definition: dehydrated sb who is dehydrated, does not have enough liquid in their body and feels weak and ill:mất nước
examples: when exercising, especially in the heat, drink often or you will become dehydrated.
severely dehydrated
children who have diarrhoea can quickly become severely dehydrated.

children.name: thirsty a2
children.definition: thirstykhát
examples: are you thirsty? do you want some juice?
on a hot day, your dog can become very thirsty, so make sure they have plenty of water.
by the time you actually feel thirsty, your body is already slightly dehydrated.
stands were set up to satisfy the thousands of thirsty people expected at the event.
thirstyworkuk an activity that makes you thirsty, used especially humorously when you want an alcoholic drink
i’ll have a beer. gardening is thirsty work, you know.

children.name: hungry a1
children.definition: hungry đói
examples: by four o'clock ifelt/ wasreally hungry.
we were really hungry after our long walk.
are you hungry? do you want a sandwich?
hungry shoppers waited in line at the food counters.

children.name: peckish x
children.definition: peckish/ˈpekɪʃ/  ukinformala little hungry:đói
examples: the kids were getting peckish so sammy found a cafe nearby.
i’m feeling a bit peckish. what’s in the fridge?
by ten o'clock i was feeling rather peckish, even though i'd had a large breakfast.

children.name: feel like sth to eat a1
children.definition: feel like sth to eatspokento want to eat sth:muốn cái gì đó để ăn
examples: it’s 12 o'clock - do you feel like something to eat?
do you guys want something to eat?

children.name: have the munchies x
children.definition: have/ get the munchiesinformalto begin to feel a little hungry, and want sth to eat, especially sth small rather than a large meal:có chút đói, có vẻ đói
examples: if you get the munchies later on there are some cookies in the kitchen.
i've gotthe munchies.

children.name: when people are ill or dying because they do not have enough to eat
famine c2
children.definition: famine a situation in which a large number of people in a country or area are very hungry and many die because the crops of rice, wheat etc have failed: nạn đói kém
examples: millions of people in africa continue to die because of war and famine.
the four-year drought has caused widespread famine across afghanistan.
severe/ widespread famine
widespread famine had triggered a number of violent protests.
a million people arefacing famine.

children.name: starvation c2
children.definition: starvation suffering or death caused by not having enough food to eat: sự chết đói, sự đói khát
examples: the survivors were close to starvation when they were rescued.
a global fall in the price of rice spread hardship and even starvation to many parts of indochina.
die of starvation
30 million people die of starvation each year.
brink of starvationalmost dying because of not having enough food gần như chết đói
thousands of refugees are on the brink of starvation in camps south of the capital.

children.name: hunger b2
children.definition: hunger
examples: many people could die from cold and hunger this winter as the war continues.
the slum-dwellers suffer from poverty, hunger, and disease.
all over the world, peopledie ofhunger every day.
weak with/ from hunger
weak with hunger, she staggered up to the cabin door.

children.name: not be hungry a1
children.definition: not be hungry không đói
examples: ‘how about something to eat?’ ‘no thanks, i’m not hungry.’
we offered her some sandwiches but she said she wasn’t hungry.

children.name: lose your appetite c1
children.definition: lose your appetite to no longer want to eat anything, especially because you areupsetorillorthinkingabout sth else:không thấy đói
examples: jane’s not feeling too well and has lost her appetite.
i shifted the food around my plate, suddenly losing my appetite as he told me the news.

children.name: not feel like anything a1
children.definition: not feel like/not want anythingspokeninformalsay this to tell someone that you are not hungry:không cảm thấy, muốn ăn gì cả
examples: i had a really big lunch, so i don’t feel like anything just now.
‘do you want some toast?’ ‘no thanks, i don’t want anything.’

children.name: get hungry a1
children.definition: get hungry to start to feel hungry, especially because you have not eaten for some time: đói bụng
examples: is it lunchtime yet? i’m getting hungry.
if youget hungry, there’s some cold chicken in the fridge.

children.name: work up an appetite c1
children.definition: work up an appetite to do sth to make yourself want to eat, especially by hard physical exercise:làm gì đó cho đói bụng
examples: after a long day walking across the hills they had worked up quite an appetite.
there’s nothing like skiing to work up an appetite.

children.name: give sb an appetite c1
children.definition: give sb an appetite if work, exercise, etc gives you an appetite it makes you feel hungry:khiến cho đói bụng
examples: all that exercise has given me an appetite.
spending all day in the fresh air had given them all an appetite.

children.name: starving b2
children.definition: starving sb who is starving has not had enough food for a long time and will die soon if they do not eat: đói khát
examples: the people are starving and they need all the food and medical supplies we can give them.
they have barely enough money to keep them from starving.
a country full of starving people
the starvingpeople who are starving những người đói
the homeless and the starving, refugees of the war, were flocking to the cities.

children.name: starve c1
children.definition: starve to have so little food to eat that you become ill or die: đói khát
examples: the prisoners were taken out into the desert and left to starve.
in 1884, the crew of young’s ship nearly starved when they were blown off course.
starve to deathstarve and die chết đói
unless these people get food in the next two weeks they will starve to death.

children.name: hungry a1
children.definition: hungry if people are hungry, they need food but do not have enough food to eat over a long period of time:bị bỏ đói
examples: my children are hungry, i need a job.
hungry people crowded around the relief wagon for food.
go hungrynot get food to eat đói
if the crops fail again this year thousands of people will go hungry.
thousands of families go hungry every day.
she oftengoeshungry herself (= does not eat) so that her children can have enough to eat.

children.name: not get enough to eat a1
children.definition: not get enough to eat to not be given enough food, so that you are becoming ill: thiếu ăn
examples: the refugees in the camps are not getting enough to eat, and the living conditions are terrible.
a baby who is not gaining weight is probably not getting enough to eat.

children.name: half-starved x
children.definition: half-starved thin and looking ill because you do not have enough to eat:đói khát
examples: poor dog! he looks half-starved.
the soldiers were dirty and half-starved.

children.name: underfed x
children.definition: underfed written people or animals who are underfed are not being given enough food to eat:thiếu ăn, bị bỏ đói
examples: the servants were overworked and underfed.
fields full of underfed cattle

children.name: on an empty stomach x
children.definition: on an empty stomach
examples: without eating anything
_you shouldn't go to work on an empty stomach.

children.name: make sb's mouth water x
children.definition: makesb'smouth water làmaithèm chảy nước dãi
examples: if the smell or sight of food makes your mouth water, it makes you want to eat it
_the smell of that bacon cooking is making my mouth water.

children.name: smack your lips x
children.definition: smackyourlips
examples: to close and open your mouth loudly to express a strong wish to eat something you like a lot
_"i adore chocolate cake, " said susannah, smacking her lips.

children.name: i could eat a horse x
children.definition: i could eat a horse!spokenhumorous used to say that you are very hungry :
examples: ‘are you hungry?’ ‘yeah, i could eat a horse.’

children.name: starving b2
children.definition: starving/ ravenous/starvedus  spoken very hungry:đói chết được, đói cồn cào
examples: can we talk about this after dinner, please? i’m famished.
i missed lunch and i’m starved.
normally she did not eat a lot in the morning, but today she was ravenous.
absolutely starving/ ravenous
i’ve been driving for eight hours non-stop and i am absolutely starving.

children.name: famished x
children.definition: famishedvery hungry.famishedis less common and sounds a little more formal thanstarvingorravenous:
examples: everyone was famished by the time they arrived.

children.name: the feeling you have when you are thirsty
thirst b2
children.definition: thirst the feeling of wanting to drink sth:cơn khát
examples: the soldiers suffered constantly from hunger and thirst.
maggie woke up with araging thirst(= an extremely strong thirst ).
quench your thirstget rid of your thirst by drinking somethinglàm hết khát
after a workout, juices are excellent because they quench your thirst and replace fluids and carbohydrates.
die of thirstdied from a lack of sth to drinkchết khát
seven people died of thirst after their truck broke down on an isolated desert road.
work up a thirstdo work or exercise that makes you thirsty
the bars and cafes cater to tourists who have worked up a thirst sightseeing.

children.name: be dying for b1
children.definition: be dying for/be gasping foruk spokento want to drink sth very much:muốn uống cạn
examples: we were dying for a coke, so we stopped at a fast-food place.
i’m gasping for a cup of tea.
be dying for a drinkto want to drink sth, especially alcohol
i’m dying for a drink. want to go for a pint?

children.name: parched x
children.definition: parched informal if sb is parched they are very thirsty. you can also say that they have a parched throat or parched lips when they are very dry and they need a drink:khát khô cổ họng
examples: she put her water bottle to his parched lips.
give me a sip of that i’m parched.
they were dirty and parched, but in remarkably good condition after the rescue.
